item.title: Inventing the Y-Combinator
item.description: In this post we will derive the Y-combinator from first principles. In other words, we will invent a reusable way to use recursion in lambda calculus. Step 1: Start with a function \( f \) whose implementation is self-referencing. Then the body of \( f \) must look like: \[ f = ...f...f... \] Here we use \( ... \) to denote any lambda calculus expression.
